result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaquill C Wyatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 5:00pm. Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with any Meyers Store locations.
- Successfully complete the Thinking for a Change Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaquill C Wyatt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaquill C Wyatt in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jaquill C Wyatt.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 7 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm.
- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Seek and Maintain full-time employment.
- No Contact with any Meyers Store locations.
- Successfully complete the Thinking for a Change Program.

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 5:00pm.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Elements of the Offense/WIS JI - Criminal
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Jaquill C Wyatt in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jaquill C Wyatt.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jaquill C Wyatt in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Based on defendant's appearance in Court, Court orders stayed bench warrant cancelled and the calendar call scheduled for 08/31/2022 to convert to pretrial conference.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case heard off the record due to court reporter availability. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, on 7/25/2022 the Court will order a bench warrant issued and will stay the issuance until the next court date.  Other in-court activity scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meijer Foods  Tosa, 11111 W. Burleigh St., Wauwatosa, WI 53222.

Defendant Jaquill C Wyatt in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 13, RESERVE JUDGES, in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/2022 @2:30p
